page.title: 10Law and Order in St.Albans.
page.content: St.Albans{prison}was closed in 1924. It is often used in films though.We have a{Crown court,}serving{Herts}and {Beds}and a{police station}in the Civic Centre built in the 1960s.{Crime}is not increasing much here and is average for the country.{Watford}is busier.We have{125 police}and{8 police {cars.}Our market encourages{pick- {pockets.}There are{3 Magistrates {courts}and{4 Crown courts.}Some long and complex trials go to London,but cases of{murder}are tried here.Herts has quite a few cases of arson of all kinds.The{trial}of{"The Fox" }was the most important recent trial held here. all the{juries}come from Herts.{High {court judges }come 3 times a year.St. Albans has the court because although it is not the county town,it is very central and has always had a court.A {new crown court}is being planned.
